page.title: 11MISS GREENFIELD OF ECCLES
page.content: Four children from St Peters School were invited in Miss Greenfields home to talk with her.She showed her home, still gaslit,having no electricty & containing a hand operated mangle & milk maids yoke,to the children.A village resident for all her 69yrs she continues a life long association with the chapel by playing the organ, a task she began 40yrs ago.She still holds the key to the chapel.Her grandfather laid the foundation stone of the chapel in 1931 & his services to the village were such that a road is named after him.Miss greenfield has lived in four different houses in the village & she remembers a time when there were 14 shops & a cement works. Eccles Row was once known as Tickle Belly Row.
